alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Northwest Aroostook; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 05 at 9:32PM EST until March 06 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 5 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of one to two inches possible. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Northern Penobscot, Southeast Aroostook, Northeast Aroostook, and Northwest Aroostook Counties. * WHEN...From 3 AM to 5 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility in open terrain, and cause whiteout conditions at times. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes. Strong winds could cause isolated damage to trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This will impact Route 1, 1A, 11, 161 and numerous other state and local roads across the agricultural areas of Aroostook County and Northern Penobscot County.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory for snow and blowing snow means blowing snow will cause travel difficulties. Expect snow covered roads and limited visibilities in open terrain, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Northwest Aroostook; Southeast Aroostook
